title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders' Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured while attempting to block an extra point and requires surgery for his quad injury.
Former Patriots player Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early considered for another start after striking out 11 batters in MLB debut with Boston Red Sox.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora to decide by Sunday on pitching options for Tuesday's game against the Athletics.
Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison provide depth to manage workload of top starters like Giolito and Bello.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his contract opt-out after the Red Sox season ends.
Bregman signed a three-year, $120 million contract with a potential opt-out after the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
He has contributed significantly to the Red Sox, batting .279 with an .836 OPS, and mentoring younger players.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 is now streaming on Hulu, featuring entries by Christoph Waltz and Renée Zellweger.
'Misery', a Stephen King horror adaptation, is currently available to stream on HBO Max.
Amazon Prime Video is streaming 'The Girlfriend', a psychological thriller starring Robin Wright and Olivia Cooke.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots players Christian Gonzalez and Keion White are ruled out for Sunday's game against the Dolphins.
Gonzalez is out with a hamstring injury sustained in July, while White's absence is due to an illness.
Two other Patriots, Marte Mapu and Morgan Moses, are listed as questionable for the matchup against Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins with Terrell Williams unavailable.
Kuhr is the Patriots' inside linebackers coach, having joined the team in his first season this year.
Kuhr previously worked with coach Mike Vrabel at Ohio State and was a defensive assistant for the Giants.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges before her trial next month.
Cannon-Grant is charged with defrauding donors and obtaining false unemployment benefits, jeopardizing up to decades of imprisonment.
Prosecutors allege she used nonprofit funds for personal expenses; a change-of-plea hearing date is not yet set.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested on suspicion of shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, facing multiple felony charges.
Robinson, a third-year electrical apprentice, is not affiliated with any political party and has no prior criminal record.
Family members described Robinson as becoming more politically engaged, criticizing Kirk for spreading hate before the shooting.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees vie for top wild-card spot in critical Fenway Park series starting Friday.
Boston leads season series with Yankees 8-2, dominating recent matchups with strong pitching performances.
Both teams face pivotal rotational strategies as Max Fried pitches for Yankees against Brayan Bello on Saturday.

title: Winthrop loses $1.2M in climate grants over MBTA Communities Act noncompliance
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Winthrop loses $1.2 million in climate grants due to noncompliance with MBTA Communities Act requirements for multifamily housing.
Funding aimed at addressing flooding in Morton and Pico/Fisherman's Bend neighborhoods was denied by the Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs.
The loss of funds impacts town infrastructure, sparking local criticism and potential tax increases for residents to cover shortfalls.
